result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W Kremer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit For Time Served 0 Days, If Revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Buy Money, Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $25.00 per moth starting 10-01-2015.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Mental Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  
Court allows disclosure of Dr. Collins report dated 06-20-2014.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Tell each doctor all prescriptions being taken including those other doctors are prescribing.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

timeConds.notes: First 30 days Straight Time (Jail). Last 30 days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to include Community Service activities and volunteering.  STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.
